title: How to Start or Create a Freezer Cooking Group

steps.headline: Share the community effort with friends.
Meet in advance and select the freezer meals you wish to prepare.
Decide on a work schedule.
steps.description: Delegate who will do the shopping, prep work, hosting etc.

steps.headline: Start with a small group.
steps.description: Choose four friends to share the group cooking experience. Each friend can easily cook 7 to 8 freezer meals adding up to a month's worth of meals prepared together as a group during the Cooking Day.

steps.headline: Cooking Day: Gather together at the designated location.
Seal up the meals in freezer storage bags or chosen freezer-safe food containers.
Take the prepared meals home and place them in the freezer.
steps.description: Once the meals are frozen, you can stack the frozen meals like books, if using freezer bags.

text: Share the community effort with friends.  Meet in advance and select the freezer meals you wish to prepare. Designate who will Decide on a work schedule. Delegate who will do the shopping, prep work, hosting etc. Rotate the chores monthly.  Start with a small group. Choose four friends to share the group cooking experience. Each friend can easily cook 7 to 8 freezer meals adding up to a month's worth of meals prepared together as a group during the Cooking Day. Cooking Day: Gather together at the designated location. Start cooking. Seal up the meals in freezer storage bags or chosen freezer-safe food containers.  Take the prepared meals home and place them in the freezer. Once the meals are frozen, you can stack the frozen meals like books, if using freezer bags.
